intro: Chromolaena galeana, commonly known as Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, appearing in clusters at the ends of branches. Chromolaena galeana is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands.
